title: unexpected keyword argument 'feature_names' || shap.plots.text Example
body:
Hi,

I am trying to run the example code(sentiment analysis of IMDB movie reviews) on the URL "https://shap.readthedocs.io/en/latest/example_notebooks/api_examples/plots/text.html". 

I am getting the following error while building the explainer
> **explainer = shap.Explainer(f, tokenizer)**

Following is the error I am getting.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-5aaa1c74cc14> in <module>()
      1 # build an explainer using a token masker
----> 2 explainer = shap.Explainer(f, tokenizer)

/usr/local/lib/python3.6/dist-packages/shap/explainers/_explainer.py in __init__(self, model, masker, link, algorithm, output_names, feature_names, **kwargs)
    139             elif algorithm == "partition":
    140                 self.__class__ = explainers.Partition
**--> 141                 explainers.Partition.__init__(self, model, self.masker, link=self.link, feature_names=self.feature_names, output_names=self.output_names**, **kwargs)
    142             elif algorithm == "tree":
    143                 self.__class__ = explainers.Tree

TypeError: __init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'feature_names'
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I have tried running in Google Colab (python 3.6.9) and in Jupyter(Python 3.8), but getting the same error.

I have also tried uninstalling the current version of SHAP and installing shap 0.19.2, but still No Luck..!

**Need help**. 
Might be a bug in the SHAP.
